intro: Dicerma elegans, commonly known as the elegant dicerma, is a member of the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Dicerma elegans is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and unique fragrance.
